DataElement.preferredDefinition: Indicator to signify whether or not the patient has a concurrent malignancy.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time._A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004_Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Occurring or operating at the same time.:A tumor composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues.  Malignant neoplasms usually metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision.  The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas (adenocarcinomas or squamous cell carcinomas), Hodgkin's and non-Hodgkin's lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas. -- 2004

Concepts.definition: Occurring or operating at the same time.

A neoplasm composed of atypical neoplastic, often pleomorphic cells that invade other tissues. Malignant neoplasms often metastasize to distant anatomic sites and may recur after excision. The most common malignant neoplasms are carcinomas, Hodgkin and non-Hodgkin lymphomas, leukemias, melanomas, and sarcomas.

Property.preferredDefinition: Occurrence; an instance of something happening.

Concepts.definition: An instance of something happening, such as an event or incident.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a concu
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concurrent malignancy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC Question Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concurrent malignancy other than curatively treated basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma in situ of the cervix, breast, or bladder?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1501 Alt Question
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concurrent malignancy other than curatively treated basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma in situ of the cervix, breast, or bladder?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Evidence of concurrent malignancies (other than cutaneous non-melanoma) or treated prostate cancer in situ

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG CRF_Text 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have evidence of concurrent malignancies (other than cutaneous non-melanoma skin cancer or localized prostate cancer)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1603
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concurrent malignancy other than curatively treated basal or squamous cell carcinoma of the skin or carcinoma in situ of the cervix, breast, or bladder (patients with low-risk prostate cancer on active surveillance are eligible)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG CRF Text 01
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a concurrent malignancy or history of treatment (other than surgery) for another tumor within the last year?
